melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਮਰਣ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਸਾਰ ਨ ਜਾਨੈ ॥

translation.text: You do not understand the nature of death and liberation.

transliteration.text: maran mukat gat sār n jānai .

melody.description: Malhar is a communication of feelings from the soul, to show the mind how to become cool and refreshed. The mind is always burning with the desire to reach its goals quickly and without effort, however the emotions conveyed in this Raag are able to bring composure and fulfilment to the mind. It is able to bring the mind into this calmness, bringing a sense of satisfaction and contentment.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: You are sitting on the river-bank; realize the Word of the Guru's Shabad. ||1||

melody.description: Malhar is a communication of feelings from the soul, to show the mind how to become cool and refreshed. The mind is always burning with the desire to reach its goals quickly and without effort, however the emotions conveyed in this Raag are able to bring composure and fulfilment to the mind. It is able to bring the mind into this calmness, bringing a sense of satisfaction and contentment.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: You stork! - how were you caught in the net?

text: ਅਲਖੁ ਨ ਜਾਚਹਿ ਰਿਦੈ ਸਮ੍ਹਾਲਿ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: You do not remember in your heart the Unseen Lord God. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: alakh n jāchah ridai samhāl .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Malhar is a communication of feelings from the soul, to show the mind how to become cool and refreshed. The mind is always burning with the desire to reach its goals quickly and without effort, however the emotions conveyed in this Raag are able to bring composure and fulfilment to the mind. translation.text: For your one life, you consume many lives.

translation.text: You were supposed to swim in the water, but you are drowning in it instead. ||2||

text: ਜਬ ਗਲਿ ਫਾਸ ਪੜੀ ਅਤਿ ਭਾਰੀ ॥

translation.text: When the heavy noose is placed around your neck,

transliteration.text: jab gal phās parī at bhārī .

translation.text: you may spread your wings, but you shall not be able to fly. ||4||

translation.text: You enjoy the tastes and flavors, you foolish self-willed manmukh.

translation.text: You are trapped. You can only be saved by virtuous conduct, spiritual wisdom and contemplation. ||5||

text: ਹਰਿ ਕਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਰਖੈ ਉਰਿ ਧਾਰਿ ॥੭॥

translation.text: Keep the Name of the Lord enshrined in your heart. ||7||

transliteration.text: har kā nām rakhai ur dhār .7.

text: ਸੇ ਦੁਖ ਆਗੈ ਜਿ ਭੋਗ ਬਿਲਾਸੇ ॥

translation.text: One who is obsessed with enjoying pleasures here, shall suffer in pain hereafter.

transliteration.text: sē dukh āgai j bhōg bilāsē .

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਨਹੀ ਬਿਨੁ ਨਾਵੈ ਸਾਚੇ ॥੮॥੨॥੫॥

translation.text: O Nanak, there is no liberation without the True Name. ||8||2||5||

transliteration.text: nānak mukat nahī bin nāvai sāchē .8.2.5.
